quoteFirst: But she came at last, and it was
quoteLast: . He hurried her luggage downstairs, booked it with his own, and in another minute they were in a hansom--their first experience of that species of conveyance--on the way to the Vestry office. They had said scarcely anything to one another, save hasty directions from Lewisham, but their eyes were full of excitement, and under the apron of the cab their hands were gripped together.
title: Love and Mr. Lewisham
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George), 1866-1946

quoteFirst: (Frankfurt) ask |               |   "Are there any boats around |               |   you already."   No reply. |               | 11.47 p. m.|
quoteLast: | Baltic tells Titanic, "We are rushing |               |   to you." |               | 11.50 p. m.|   1.40 a. m.
title: Loss of the Steamship "Titanic"
author: Great Britain. Court to investigate loss of steamship "Titanic"
